cab.translation[0].definitions[0].note.t: call (somebody) a cab (=telephone for a taxi)
cab.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Ralph tried to hail a cab  (=wave to get a cab to stop for you).
I took a cab to the airport.
cab.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: the part of a bus, train, or truck in which the driver sits
cab.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a carriage pulled by horses that was used like a taxi in the past
cab.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: Why don't we take a cab to the theater?
Here's the phone number if you want to call a cab.
There's no need to give me a lift. I'll phone for a cab.
I just saw Fiona getting into a cab.
Martin put his hand out and hailed a cab.
Many cab drivers fear being robbed.
My Dad gave me the money for my cab fare.
It's only a short cab ride to Georgetown.
cab.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: a British organization supported by the government which gives free advice to ordinary people about legal, financial, and other problems. Most towns and cities in the UK have a Citizens Advice Bureau, and most of the people who work for it are volunteers (=they are not paid for their work).
